text:
Eric Scullin is an American musical artist and producer based in Mount Washington, Los Angeles. He is the lead singer of indie rock duo band "Dysplay".
Career.
In 2008, Eric released the debut full-length Discretion with his first band "Dolphin City". He met future bandmate and collaborator Devin Hoffman while they attended music school at University of Southern California.
Notably, he produced the track "NY Anthem" with RZA in 2013, which which was heard at Yankee Stadium and several TV broadcasts. While working on his own releases as lead singer of Dysplay, he has worked with an eclectic range of artists onstage and in the studio.
He has appeared on The Late Late Show with James Corden and Today Show with John K.

annotations.surface_form: The Late Late Show with James Corden
